intro: Olearia rugosa subsp. allenderae, commonly known as the Allender's silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many familiar flowering plants. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
